item.title: Brute-force attacks target Apache Tomcat management panels
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A coordinated campaign of brute-force attacks using hundreds of unique IP addresses targets Apache Tomcat Manager interfaces exposed online. [...]

item.title: Operation Secure disrupts global infostealer malware operations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An international law enforcement action codenamed "Operation Secure" targeted infostealer malware infrastructure in a massive crackdown across 26 countries, resulting in 32 arrests, data seizures, and server takedowns. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes unreachable Windows Server domain controllers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has resolved a known issue that caused some Windows Server 2025 domain controllers to become unreachable after a restart and triggered app or service failures. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server auth issues caused by April updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing authentication problems on Windows Server domain controllers after installing the April 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: DanaBot malware operators exposed via C2 bug added in 2022
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in the DanaBot malware operation introduced in June 2022 update led to the identification, indictment, and dismantling of their operations in a recent law enforcement action. [...]

item.title: ConnectWise rotating code signing certificates over security concerns
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ConnectWise is warning customers that it is rotating the digital code signing certificates used to sign ScreenConnect, ConnectWise Automate, and ConnectWise RMM executables over security concerns. [...]

item.title: New Secure Boot flaw lets attackers install bootkit malware, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Security researchers have disclosed a new Secure Boot bypass tracked as CVE-2025-3052 that can be used to turn off security on PCs and servers and install bootkit malware. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5060533 cumulative update released with 7 changes, fixes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5060533 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, with seven fixes or changes, including bringing seconds back to the time shown in the Calendar flyout. [...]

item.title: Microsoft June 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes exploited zero-day, 66 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's June 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 66 flaws, including one actively exploited vulnerability and another that was publicly disclosed. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5060842 and KB5060999 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5060842 and KB5060999 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues, including 66 flaws. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Outlook to block more risky attachments used in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced it will expand the list of blocked attachments in Outlook Web and the new Outlook for Windows starting next month. [...]

item.title: Texas Dept. of Transportation breached, 300k crash records stolen
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) is warning that it suffered a data breach after a threat actor downloaded 300,000 crash records from its database. [...]

item.title: FIN6 hackers pose as job seekers to backdoor recruiters’ devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: In a twist on typical hiring-related social engineering attacks, the FIN6 hacking group impersonates job seekers to target recruiters, using convincing resumes and phishing sites to deliver malware. [...]
